page.title: 06OUR CHURCH (cont.)
page.content: The other wall-painting shows when Cuthbert,nearing the end of his life, went round to visit all his friends in the north. While he was staying at the Abbey of Abbess Aelfleda he had a vision of someone holy falling out of a tree.At the same time a shepherd had really fallen out of a tree. The next alterations were made by Bishop Pudsey and his masons.They made some amazing arches which consisted of precise masonry and dogtooth moulding. It was so accurate that the blocks of stone could be turned upside down and still fit together. In Norman times there wasn't any tower and the present one was added to the West end of the nave in the late 12th century. We think the church is one of the most beautiful Parish Churches and Architectural treasures of the country
